name: General Castro
description: General Jose Leon Castro has been brought to power by hook or by crook, and Honduras now enters an era of military dictatorship, all in the name of strengthening the nation against the outsiders!

name: The Autocratic Republic
description: No more of this 'peasant republic' nonsense. We shall elevate General Castro to the title of Supreme Autocrat and do away with this democratic foolishness.

name: Cult of Personality
description: You say cult like it's a bad thing. General Castro is justly revered and worshiped for his benevolence.

name: Border Patrols
description: After the border clash with El Salvador and Nicaragua, discipline is needed to ensure that we don't lose another one. Furthermore, we must raise, train, and equip a proper border patrol.

name: Freedom of the Press?
description: General Castro of course supports freedom of speech and of the press. Provided, of course, that they say nice things about him.

name: O Death, Where is Thy Victory?
description: O Grave, Where is Thy Sting? Nicaragua has fallen to our might!

name: Ideological Crusade
description: A great crusade must now begin in all of Central America, a grand propaganda campaign to remind the people of the evils of socialism.

name: Death to Socialists
description: There is no polite way to phrase it: socialists must die if Honduras is to avoid the revolution and madness that blighted her in the early 1930's.

name: Purge Corrupt Officials
description: Corruption is endemic in the consular bureaucracy. By rooting it out and replacing it with a stratocratic system of military government we can keep proper discipline.

name: The Corporate Economy
description: Through the use of corporate power, Honduras can become stronger. Collaborating with companies like the United Fruit Company will enable us to exert control over the market.

name: Aid the UFC
description: The United Fruit Company's operations were sadly curtailed by the misguided old government. While they remained active, their influence and ability to expand were hampered. In order to ensure a future for Honduras, we must rectify this.

name: Rich in Potassium
description: Did you know bananas are good for you? Well, now you do! More bananas must be grown, straightened and exported from Honduras in order to grow her economy.

name: Forced Labour
description: It seems that some of our people disagree with our policy of collaborating with the UFC so heavily in order to sell bananas to all and sundry. We have a solution to this: the whip!

name: Transoceanic Railway
description: By building a railway connecting the two oceans, we can improve our commercial health as well as connecting our cities together to better open our markets for business.

name: Ties with the UFC
description: Seeing as the UFC intends to expand their investments in our newly business-friendly economy, we must deepen our ties with the UFC.

name: Economic Boom
description: The growth in the economy engendered by our vigorous commitment to bananas will let us grow our important industries too.

name: Chairman [HONleadloc_scripted2]
description: [HONleadloc_scripted2] has won a free and fair election and will now embark on a programme of free-market reform.

name: Expand the Coffee Industry
description: Coffee is already well-supplied by the rest of the world, but expanding our business in that sector would be a start towards diversifying our banana-dependent economy.

name: Improve the Infrastructure
description: Expanding infrastructure is vital to Honduras's future as a modern nation.

name: Lower the Taxes
description: Lowering taxes across the board, from the poorest to the richest, may make the state a little poorer, but it will enrich our people and free up funds for them to invest.

name: Free Market Economy
description: We must unshackle our businesses from pointless red tape. The freer the market, the freer the people!

name: Cooperate with the UFC
description: We must establish a relationship with the UFC, but one rooted in mutual respect and exchange rather than in exploitation and hostility.

name: Labour Regulations
description: [HONleadloc_scripted2]'s administration has seen the introduction of labour regulations for children and women and the establishment of an eight-hour working day in the Honduran Congress. Congress passing these laws will mark a monumental change in Honduras' labour laws.

name: Education Reform
description: By providing sizable incentives to attract foreign teachers, we can improve the education of our youth, gradually reform our school system and improve our research.

name: Urbanize the Countryside
description: By promoting movement to the cities, we will grow the Honduran economy and population, and make ourselves less rural and fruit-dependent.

name: The Pan-American Agricultural School
description: By creating a school for all of the Americas to study the latest methods of agriculture, we can improve our methods, strengthen our international ties, and advance our understanding of chemistry.

name: Peace and Security
description: Peace and security are the two watchwords of our government. Wherever there is policy, it must promote peace and security.

name: Increase Press Freedom
description: A truly free press is necessary for a truly free Honduras!

name: Modernize the State
description: Bureaucratic reform must be pushed forward in order to safeguard liberalism in the Americas.

name: Love Thy Neighbour
description: In these trying times, the Christian values shared by many Hondurans are among the few things we all have to hold dear.

name: Long Live Democracy
description: Here in Honduras we will build a democracy that all of Central America will envy! Viva la republica!

name: Chairman [HONleadloc_scripted]
description: [HONleadloc_scripted] has won a free and fair election and will now embark on a programme of much-needed social reform.

name: Land Reform
description: Redistribution of land to the landless is a vital step to ensure universal prosperity.

name: Industrial Development
description: By funding industrial development, Honduras is more than capable of achieving great wealth for herself.

name: Expand Banana Production
description: The humble banana is a vital part of the Honduran economy. By encouraging small plantations to expand production, we can grow this sector of our economy without resorting to concessions to the United Fruit Company.

name: The Economics of Liberty
description: The freedom to buy and sell, without favour to large business, is an essential underpinning of our strategy to bring freedom to the Honduran people.

name: The Free Press
description: A truly free press is necessary for a truly free Honduras!

name: Woo the Southern Periphery
description: By looking for friends abroad we may defend ourselves from others who would prey on us. Let's start to our south.

name: Guarantee the Northern Border
description: Guaranteeing the borders of our northern neighbour, and inducing them to do likewise, is a vital step towards peace in our time.

name: Undermine the UFC Monopoly
description: Independent fruit producers, protected from UFC thugs, can grow our bananas just fine without the exploitation and suffering that comes from corporate economics.

name: Promote Unionisation
description: By promoting unions and peaceful dialogue with employers, we can better working conditions all over the country.

name: Expand Education
description: Many of our populace are still illiterate, which holds back our economy and intellectual life. We must solve this problem through dedicated investment by the state.

name: Protect the Unemployed
description: The unemployed, the sick, the elderly. All these people require our protection if they are to thrive.

name: Enshrine Human Rights
description: By promoting a charter of basic human rights and enshrining it in law we can help to create an institutional framework to protect the people long after this government ends.

name: The Bastion of Liberalism
description: Honduras will remain a bastion of liberalism for years to come, promoting the dignity, equality, and fraternity of all men.

name: Sovereign, Independent and Free
description: We will never bow our heads to tyrants again, we are now and forever Sovereign, Independent and Free.

name: The Revolution Triumphant
description: The revolutionary state rises, no more the Peasants' Republic but now truly the People's Republic.

name: Premier Callejas
description: The Callejistas and their revolutionary programme have entered centre stage, and now begins what they term the 'permanent revolution'

name: Organize Diplomatic Missions
description: One of Callejas' first projects is the organisation of the diplomatic corps to reach out to syndicalists the world over and ensure good relations with them.

name: State Atheism
description: Though Catholicism has deep roots, they must be dug up, the church is an implement of reactionary thought.

name: Red Shirts
description: Wearing their fine red shirts, our youth wing is ready to provide volunteers for the revolution.

name: End the Rivalry
description: The rivalry between the two of us must end, for what are we if not brothers in the quest for socialism?

name: Purge the Right
description: Oh, come on, you knew this one was coming.

name: Patriotic Front
description: So long as they agree to root out reactionary thought within their own ranks, the Callejistas are more than willing for form a united front with other leftists.

name: The Socialist Republic
description: While really only a formality, the official designation of Honduras as a 'socialist republic' rather than a simple 'republic' is of vital ceremonial importance.

name: Planned Economy
description: By assuming direct control of the economy, we can prevent the export of vital Honduran resources and put them to our own use.

name: Establish Unions
description: Establishing self-managed unions in Honduras, under the strict guidance of the party, will be essential to our new economy.

name: The Hammer and the Sickle
description: The first project is to expand tool making, to ensure that there are enough hammers, sickles and shovels for the new economy.

name: Repatriate Americans
description: Banish the American scum! They have exploited the people for too long!

name: Collectivisation
description: The second project is the seizure of banana plantations and private farms in order to create a new crop of collective enterprises.

name: Collective Farming
description: Collective farming is now well established. It must be massively expanded in order to feed our burgeoning population.

name: Collective Housing
description: In order to assure homes for all the people of Honduras, we should abolish the family, and instead encourage people to cohabit in large dormitories with shared living space.

name: Seize UFC assets
description: The third project is to officially ban the United Fruit Company and all related to it, in order to smash the capitalist system in our nation.

name: Industrial Unionism
description: Taking the unions from the farms to the factories is the fourth project.

name: The Transoceanic Railway
description: The fifth project, a railroad from coast to coast, will be an excellent symbol of our prosperity and the worth of the revolution.

name: Totalist Utopia
description: Have the people ever been happier or more free than under Premier Callejas' guiding hand? No, of course not.

name: State of the Army
description: We're currently still suffering the effect of last year's army purge. If we wish to get our army back on its feet, we shall need to start assessing the status of the army.

name: Military Infrastructure
description: In Central America, you don't just need rifles and the will to win wars, you also need the supplies to do so. The harsh terrain of the region makes supply chains hard to establish, so we should look into expanding our infrastructure as to not suffer shortages.

name: Military-Industrial Complex
description: Honduras will need to produce its own war material if it hopes to survive the incoming storm. We must invest in the development of a small scale military-industrial complex to feed our war machine.

name: Professional Army
description: A professional army will stand supreme in Central America! We cannot afford to waste huge amounts of manpower like Guatemala or El Salvador, so we will have to rely on quality over quantity.

name: Standardized Equipment
description: We don't possess a standard rifle, and we're mostly using leftovers that Spain was so kind to allow us to buy on the cheap a few years ago. We need to change that, so we shall start rifle trials to adopt one model as standard.

name: Heavy Equipment
description: We don't only need rifles, we also need heavy guns to pound the enemy's position. We shall invest in artillery so that the enemy will never feel safe either in the battlefield or in the trenches.

name: Organized Chain of Command
description: Our current chain of command is murky and ineffective at best, especially in the wake of our army purges. A restructuring is in order in order to provide clear command hierarchy and allow our soldiers to regroup under a different commanding officer.

name: Trained Officers
description: Our officers currently hardly know anything about formal military doctrine. We will have to formally train them in a Honduran way of war if we wish to stand a chance against our enemies.

name: Loyal Army
description: Our loyal army is the backbone of the nation's armed forces; well, what would be a loyal army if not for a bunch of unpatriotic soldiers waiting to mutiny and totally lacking in loyalty to the nation! We must deal with this rabble.

name: Irregular Army
description: We cannot hope to match our enemies in normal warfare. We must, therefore, think outside the box to lure them out of the traditional battlefields.

name: Autonomous Officers
description: Our officers must have enough autonomy as to adapt to combat situations without contacting high command. We shall grant them said autonomy and teach them what to do if they are cut-off.

name: Adapting to the Terrain
description: The harsh terrain in Central America is proving treacherous for our men. We will have to teach them to adapt in the varying environments. Geography shall be our ally, not our enemy!

name: Guerrilla Tactics
description: We cannot hope to match Guatemala or El Salvador in open combat. We will have to fight smart, lure them into ambushes, and pick our fights carefully. The spirit of guerrilla fighting follows these ideas, and it is the doctrine we shall follow.

name: Guerrilla Spirit
description: We don't just need the tactics, we also need the fighting spirit! Our soldiers must be ready to do whatever it takes to win, be it fairly or else...

name: Large Army
description: A large army is the only way we can beat the Nicaraguans with inferior numbers and hold off the Salvadorians and Guatemalans who outnumber us. Unless we can cover the whole front, we won’t stand a chance.

name: Equipment Imports
description: Purchasing foreign equipment has long been the lifeblood of our army, as we lack the significant domestic capacity required to produce our own.

name: Local Production
description: We cannot depend on foreign imports forever. We need to make a move towards self-sufficiency and start our own local rifle production.

name: Successful Professionalisation
description: Our professionalisation efforts are starting to give us results. Our officers are amongst the best of the continent and our chain of command is as stable as any European military.

name: Successful Enlargement
description: Our enlargement efforts are starting to prove successful. Our army is now well equipped and capable of holding up the entire front.

name: Military Research
description: Regardless of our choices in terms of doctrine, there's no denying that we have a shortage of specialists and technicians whose expertise could give us the upper hand in a conflict. We need to start attracting them to serve our cause!

name: The FAH
description: Our military high command has officially inaugurated the Fuerza Aérea Hondureña to take flight against our enemies.

name: Air Officers
description: An Air Corps composed of brave volunteer pilots has been founded in Tegucigalpa to lead the way for other more wary conscripts.

name: Land-based AA
description: Recently purchased anti-air weapons will be able to safeguard our skyline from enemy aircraft, keeping our heartland safe.

name: Tegucigalpa Airfield
description: We have cleared out land for airstrips to accommodate a modern air fleet to defend ourselves.

name: Fighters for the FAH
description: Solid fighter planes are essential to meet and defeat the bombers entering out homeland. Those heroes have it hard out there.

name: CAS aircraft for the FAH
description: Multi-purpose close air support helps us defend out convoys and air operations.

name: Bombers for the FAH
description: The dream of safely ensuring victory from the air has finally arrived to the FAH.

name: Protecting the Sky
description: We must mobilise our citizenry to protect critical depots from air attacks, as well as to guard our borders.

name: Naval Air Coordination
description: The military high command has finally accepted the equal status of the FAH in military coordination and planning.

name: Naval Bombers for the FAH
description: Specially designed bombers capable of destroying naval vessels will someday save our hides.

name: The FNH
description: Our military high command has officially inaugurated the Fuerza Naval Hondureña to take back our coast from imperialists.

name: Amapala Port
description: The small port of Amapala has served Honduras in trade for decades, but shall now be fully militarised to serve her people's safety.

name: Destroyers for the FNH
description: Destroyers are essential for protecting our trade power in the Caribbean.

name: Submarines for the FNH
description: The latest in pressurized submersible seacraft will strike fear into the hearts of imperialist invaders.

name: FNH Flagship
description: A capital ship will show the world that Honduras is a world leader in naval technology.

name: Honduran Merchant Navy
description: Employing civilians in our naval network will assist in our ability to project power outwards by letting us concentrate our Navy's sailors where they are truly needed.

name: Naval Officers
description: A professional training regimen has been designed to help new naval officers transition from ceremonial to functional roles.

name: Protecting the Coastline
description: We must ensure no invader shall ever land in our country again, no matter the cost.
